instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WONT TURN...
threads.message:
This board came in for no power issue. 
After some analysis I know the issue is power button...

However I know these board turn on automatically when no battery connected and you plug in the charger. This one doesnt, it needs to trigger the pwr button but this only happen if I unplug and plug (like fast, in the same movement), if I wait a couple seconds unplugged it turns on when plugging the charger again. 

Is this behaviour normal? I remember unpluging and pluging and the board would turn on. Same bahaviour with KB disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> WONT TURN...
threads.message:
I'm pretty sure the normal user never tries such fast plugging manner.
If the machine works good, don't bother with that.
